paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm a very lucky person. I've been privileged to see so much of our beautiful Earth and the people and creatures that live on it. And my passion was inspired at the age of seven, when my parents first took me to Morocco, at the edge of the Sahara Desert.
paragraphs.en: 我是一個非常幸運的人 我很榮幸能看到我們美麗的地球上 形形色色的人和生物 我這份激情從7歲開始被啟發 當我父母第一次帶我去摩洛哥 位於撒哈拉大沙漠邊境

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now imagine a little Brit somewhere that wasn't cold and damp like home. What an amazing experience.
paragraphs.en: 想像一位小英國佬 來到一個不像家鄉不寒冷也不潮濕的地方 那種感覺很神奇

paragraphs.zh-tw: And it made me want to explore more. So as a filmmaker, I've been from one end of the Earth to the other trying to get the perfect shot and to capture animal behavior never seen before.
paragraphs.en: 而這讓我渴望繼續探索 所以作為電影工作者 我走遍世界天涯 嘗試拍攝、捕捉到有史以來 動物生態活動最完美的鏡頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: And what's more, I'm really lucky, because I get to share that with millions of people worldwide. Now the idea of having new perspectives of our planet and actually being able to get that message out gets me out of bed every day with a spring in my step.
paragraphs.en: 而讓我更感幸運的是 我可以和全世界上百萬的人分享這些鏡頭 只要想到影片可以給我們觀察地球的全新視角 並真正將這種信息傳遞出去 這種想法讓我對每一天都充滿期待

paragraphs.zh-tw: You might think that it's quite hard to find new stories and new subjects, but new technology is changing the way we can film. It's enabling us to get fresh, new images and tell brand new stories.
paragraphs.en: 你可能覺得找到新的故事 和新的主題十分困難 但新科技正在改變我們的拍攝方式 它讓我們拍到嶄新的畫面 並講述新的故事

paragraphs.zh-tw: In Nature's Great Events, a series for the BBC that I did with David Attenborough, we wanted to do just that. Images of grizzly bears are pretty familiar.
paragraphs.en: 在我和大衛‧艾登堡一起製作的 BBC的紀錄片系列《自然大事件》中 我們嘗試了新的方法 大家都很熟悉大灰熊的樣貌

paragraphs.zh-tw: You see them all the time, you think. But there's a whole side to their lives that we hardly ever see and had never been filmed.
paragraphs.en: 我想你們一天到晚都看的到 但有一部份牠們的生活型態我們幾乎沒有見過 並且從未被拍攝過

paragraphs.zh-tw: So what we did, we went to Alaska, which is where the grizzlies rely on really high, almost inaccessible, mountain slopes for their denning. And the only way to film that is a shoot from the air.
paragraphs.en: 所以，我們來到阿拉斯加 在這裡，大灰熊在 極高、人類幾乎無法到達的山脈 建造巢窩 唯一的拍攝的方式是從空中拍攝

paragraphs.zh-tw: (Video) David Attenborough: Throughout Alaska and British Columbia, thousands of bear families are emerging from their winter sleep. There is nothing to eat up here, but the conditions were ideal for hibernation.
paragraphs.en: （影片）大衛‧艾登堡： 在阿拉斯加和英屬哥倫比亞中 成千的灰熊家庭正從冬眠中蘇醒 這上頭並沒有食物可吃 但它的環境卻非常適合冬眠

paragraphs.zh-tw: Lots of snow in which to dig a den. To find food, mothers must lead their cubs down to the coast, where the snow will already be melting.
paragraphs.en: 可以在厚雪層中挖掘巢穴 爲了尋找食物，母熊必須帶著小熊仔下到海岸 那裡的雪早已逐漸融化

paragraphs.zh-tw: But getting down can be a challenge for small cubs. These mountains are dangerous places, but ultimately the fate of these bear families, and indeed that of all bears around the North Pacific, depends on the salmon.
paragraphs.en: 但從山上下來對小熊仔是一大挑戰 這些山脈是危險的地域 但最終，這些熊家庭的命運 甚至於所有在北太平洋的熊的命運 都取決於鮭魚

paragraphs.zh-tw: KB: I love that shot. I always get goosebumps every time I see it.
paragraphs.en: KB： 我很喜歡這個片段 每次看到我都會起雞皮疙瘩

paragraphs.zh-tw: That was filmed from a helicopter using a gyro-stabilized camera. And it's a wonderful bit of gear, because it's like having a flying tripod, crane and dolly all rolled into one.
paragraphs.en: 這是從直升飛機上拍攝的 用螺旋儀穩定攝影機 這個裝置很神奇 就像是將飛行的三腳架、起重機及移動攝影車合為一體的工具

paragraphs.zh-tw: But technology alone isn't enough. To really get the money shots, it's down to being in the right place at the right time.
paragraphs.en: 但僅有科技還不夠 若要拍到最頂級的畫面 最終還是要在對的地點以及對的時間

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that sequence was especially difficult. The first year we got nothing.
paragraphs.en: 而要同時天時地利非常難掌握 第一年我們什麽都沒拍到

paragraphs.zh-tw: We had to go back the following year, all the way back to the remote parts of Alaska. And we hung around with a helicopter for two whole weeks.
paragraphs.en: 我們必須在下一年 重新回到阿拉斯加偏遠地區 我們用直升機在那裡繞了整整兩個星期

paragraphs.zh-tw: And eventually we got lucky. The cloud lifted, the wind was still, and even the bear showed up.
paragraphs.en: 而最終我們還是很幸運 雲層散去，風逐漸靜止 而熊也出現了

paragraphs.zh-tw: And we managed to get that magic moment. For a filmmaker, new technology is an amazing tool, but the other thing that really, really excites me is when new species are discovered.
paragraphs.en: 然後我們拍攝了那美妙的一刻 對於一位電影導演來說 新科技非常不可思議 但另一個讓我非常、非常興奮的 是發現一個新的物種

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, when I heard about one animal, I knew we had to get it for my next series, Untamed Americas, for National Geographic. In 2005, a new species of bat was discovered in the cloud forests of Ecuador.
paragraphs.en: 當我聽到關於一種動物的信息時 我便知道我必須將它包括在下一個 為國家地理頻道做的節目《野性的美洲》 2005年，一種新的蝙蝠在厄瓜多爾 密集的森林中被發現

paragraphs.zh-tw: And what was amazing about that discovery is that it also solved the mystery of what pollinated a unique flower. It depends solely on the bat.
paragraphs.en: 而這個發現的特別之處在於 它同時也解答這個謎團究竟是什麼物種 在為一種特別的花傳遞花粉 這種花完全只靠這種蝙蝠

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, the series hasn't even aired yet, so you're the very first to see this. See what you think.
paragraphs.en: 這節目還未在電視播映 所以你們是一個看到的 看看你們覺得怎樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: (Video) Narrator: The tube-lipped nectar bat. A pool of delicious nectar lies at the bottom of each flower's long flute.
paragraphs.en: （影片） 旁白： 管吻狀花蜜蝙蝠 有美味的花蜜 在每朵花長長的花柱底端

paragraphs.zh-tw: But how to reach it? Necessity is the mother of evolution. (Music) This two-and-a-half-inch bat has a three-and-a-half-inch tongue, the longest relative to body length of any mammal in the world.
paragraphs.en: 但如何才能喝到它？ 需求是進化之母 （音樂） 這種大小2.5英吋的蝙蝠 有3.5英寸長的舌頭 其舌與身長的比例 是哺乳動物中最長的

paragraphs.zh-tw: If human, he'd have a nine-foot tongue. KB: What a tongue.
paragraphs.en: 相當於人類有9英尺長的舌頭 kB： 很奇特的舌頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: We filmed it by cutting a tiny little hole in the base of the flower and using a camera that could slow the action by 40 times. So imagine how quick that thing is in real life.
paragraphs.en: 爲了攝影它我們在花朵的底端開了一個非常小的洞 並且使用了可以將動作緩慢40倍的攝影機 所以你可以想像它在現實中有多快

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now people often ask me, "Where's your favorite place on the planet?" And the truth is I just don't have one. There are so many wonderful places.
paragraphs.en: 人們經常問我：“你全世界最喜歡哪個地方？” 事實上，我無法選擇 有太多的神奇的地方了

paragraphs.zh-tw: But some locations draw you back time and time again. And one remote location -- I first went there as a backpacker; I've been back several times for filming, most recently for Untamed Americas -- it's the Altiplano in the high Andes of South America, and it's the most otherworldly place I know.
paragraphs.en: 但有些地方可以讓你流連忘返，多次重遊故地 而有這麼一個偏遠的地域 -- 我第一次背包旅行來到那裡 而之後也爲了攝影回去過幾次 最近是爲了《野性的美洲》-- 這是南美洲安地斯山脈上的高原 它是我所見過的最超自然的地方

paragraphs.zh-tw: But at 15,000 feet, it's tough. It's freezing cold, and that thin air really gets you.
paragraphs.en: 但位於海拔一萬五千英尺，它的環境惡劣 它非常的冷 而空氣也非常的稀薄

paragraphs.zh-tw: Sometimes it's hard to breathe, especially carrying all the heavy filming equipment. And that pounding head just feels like a constant hangover.
paragraphs.en: 有些時候呼吸都很困難 特別是當你同時還帶著沉重的攝影器材 而昏沉又痛的腦袋就像宿醉一般

paragraphs.zh-tw: But the advantage of that wonderful thin atmosphere is that it enables you to see the stars in the heavens with amazing clarity. Have a look.
paragraphs.en: 但稀薄的大氣層的好處是 它讓你可以無比清晰的看到 天空中的繁星 看一下吧

paragraphs.zh-tw: (Video) Narrator: Some 1,500 miles south of the tropics, between Chile and Bolivia, the Andes completely change. It's called the Altiplano, or "high plains" -- a place of extremes and extreme contrasts.
paragraphs.en: （影片）旁白： 在熱帶以南1500英里之處 在智利和玻利維亞之間 安地斯山脈完全變的不一樣 它被叫做"阿爾蒂普拉諾" (西班牙語）或者“高原” 一個存在各式極限 和極端對比的地方

paragraphs.zh-tw: Where deserts freeze and waters boil. More like Mars than Earth, it seems just as hostile to life.
paragraphs.en: 在這裡沙漠結凍 水被蒸發 像火星不像地球 不適合生命

paragraphs.zh-tw: The stars themselves -- at 12,000 feet, the dry, thin air makes for perfect stargazing. Some of the world's astronomers have telescopes nearby.
paragraphs.en: 而繁星本身 在1萬2千英尺，乾燥但稀薄的空氣 締造了眺望星空的完美場景 世界上很多天文學家在這附近都有設立望遠鏡

paragraphs.zh-tw: But just looking up with the naked eye, you really don't need one. (Music) KB: Thank you so much for letting me share some images of our magnificent, wonderful Earth.
paragraphs.en: 但用你的雙眼抬頭看看吧 你並不需要它們 （音樂） KB： 非常感謝 讓我分享我們 宏偉壯麗的地球的影片

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you for letting me share that with you.
paragraphs.en: 感謝大家讓我與你們一同分享

title: Karen Bass Unseen Footage Untamed Nature
